{{Infobox person | name = Elizabeth Wharton Drexel | image = Elizabeth Drexel.jpg | caption = ''Portrait of Drexel by [[Giovanni Boldini]], 1905'' | birth_date = {{Birth date|1868|4|22}} | birth_place = [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1944|6|13|1868|4|22}} | death_place = [[London, England]] | burial_place = [[Dahlgren Chapel of the Sacred Heart|Dahlgren Chapel]], [[Georgetown University]], [[Washington, D.C.]] | spouse = {{marriage|John Vinton Dahlgren I
|June 29, 1889|August 11, 1899|end=his death}}
{{marriage|[[Henry Symes Lehr]]
|1901|1929|end=his death}}
{{marriage|[[John Graham Hope de la Poer Beresford, 5th Baron Decies|John Graham Beresford]]
|May 25, 1936|January 31, 1944|end=his death}} | partner = | children = Joseph Drexel Dahlgren
John Vinton Dahlgren II | parents = [[Joseph William Drexel]]
Lucy Wharton }} '''Elizabeth Wharton "Bessie" Drexel Hope de la Poer Beresford, Baroness Decies''' (April 22, 1868 – June 13, 1944) was an American author and [[Manhattan]] socialite. == Birth == She was born on April 22, 1868 in [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]] to Lucy Wharton (1841–1912) and [[Joseph William Drexel]].{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Mrs. J.W. Drexel Dead. Former Social Leader of Philadelphia and Mother of Mrs. Harry Lehr. |quote= |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=January 26, 1912}} Joseph was the son of [[Francis Martin Drexel]], the immigrant ancestor of the Drexel banking family in the United States. == Career == [[File:Drexel-Elizabeth 013.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Drexel and [[Henry Symes Lehr|Lehr]] at their wedding, 1901]] Elizabeth was an author, who published two books, ''"King Lehr" and the Gilded Age'' (1935) and ''Turn of the World'' (1937). Her first novel, published after the death of her second husband, was described as follows in ''[[Time Magazine]]'', "A bitter, disillusioned book, 'King Lehr' is memorable for the lurid light it throws on U. S. Society of the Gilded Age, may confidently be opened as one of the most startling and scandalously intimate records of life among the wealthy yet written by one of them." It tells the story of her unhappy marriage to Lehr, which was referred to as a "tragic farce" of a 28-year marriage. As with her first book, her second, and first as Lady Decies, ''Turn of the World'' was a fascinating semi-autobiographical history of American high society during the [[Gay Nineties]] up through the [[first World War]]. Upon the book's publication, [[The Pittsburgh Press]] wrote, "The magnificent spectacle that went on behind the scenes in pre-war days of society's Gilded Age at Saratoga, Newport, New York and Paris is detailed by an insider, Elizabeth, Lady Decies, who was Miss Elizabeth Wharton Drexel interesting, amusing and sometimes revolting, as with evident nostalgia she tells of extravagant parties and fortunes spent for clothes and jewels."{{cite news|title=The Former Mrs. Lehr|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1937/12/12/archives/the-former-mrs-lehr.html|accessdate=23 February 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=12 December 1937}} ==Personal life== [[File:John Vinton Dahlgren.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Drexel's first husband, John V. Dahlgren, ca. 1897]] [[File:Drexel-Elizabeth 012.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Photograph of Drexel in 1899]] ===First marriage=== On June 29, 1889,{{cite news|title=MR. DAHLGREN AND HIS BRIDE.; BEGINNING OF THEIR HONEYMOON IN A HISTORIC MARYLAND HOUSE.|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1889/07/07/archives/mr-dahlgren-and-his-bride-beginning-of-their-honeymoon-in-a.html|accessdate=23 February 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=7 July 1889}} Elizabeth married [[John Vinton Dahlgren I]] (1869–1899), a graduate from [[Georgetown University]] and the son of Admiral [[John Adolph Dahlgren]] (1809–1870) at [[St. Patrick's Cathedral (Manhattan)|St. Patrick's Cathedral]] in New York City. Together, they had two sons:{{cite news|title=JOHN VINTON DAHLGREN DEAD.; Son of the Admiral Passes Away at Colorado Springs.|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1899/08/12/archives/john-vinton-dahlgren-dead-son-of-the-admiral-passes-away-at.html|accessdate=23 February 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=12 August 1899}} * Joseph Drexel Dahlgren (1890-1891), who died as an infant * John Vinton Dahlgren Jr. (1892–1964), who married Helen Broderick in 1946,{{cite news|title=JOHN V. DAHLGREN, KIN OF DREXELS, TO MARRY|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1946/06/03/archives/john-v-dahlgren-kin-of-drexels-to-marry.html|accessdate=23 February 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=3 June 1946}}{{cite news|title=J. V. DAHLGREN LOSES SUIT.; Falls to Compel Uncle to Account for $70,000.|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1914/10/17/archives/j-v-dahlgren-loses-suit-falls-to-compel-uncle-to-account-for-70000.html|accessdate=23 February 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=17 October 1914}} was a graduate of [[Harvard]] and [[Georgetown University|Georgetown]].{{cite news|title=NUPTIALS ARE HELD FOR HELEN BRODERICK|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1946/07/15/archives/nuptials-are-held-for-helen-broderick.html|accessdate=23 February 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=15 July 1946}} During this marriage, she made generous donations to Roman Catholic charities and to [[Georgetown University]], including funds for the construction of [[Dahlgren Chapel of the Sacred Heart|Dahlgren Chapel]], named for her first son.{{cite news|title=BUILT BY MRS. DAHLGREN.; Dedication of the Chapel of the Sacred Heart at Washington.|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1893/04/17/archives/built-by-mrs-dahlgren-dedication-of-the-chapel-of-the-sacred-heart.html|accessdate=23 February 2017|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=17 April 1893}} The latter asked for her portrait, which was painted in 1899 by the Swiss-born American artist [[Adolfo Müller-Ury]] (1862–1947). Dahlgren died August 11, 1899, in Colorado Springs, Colorado, where he had gone in hopes of recovering from an illness.[https://timesmachine.nytimes.com/timesmachine/1899/08/12/102131791.pdf "John Vinton Dalhgren Dead"], ''The New York Times'', August 12, 1899. ===Second marriage=== In June 1901, Elizabeth married [[Henry Symes Lehr]] (1869–1929), aka Harry Lehr.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Record of the Rich |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,711722,00.html?iid=chix-sphere |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date= August 5, 1935|accessdate=2007-07-21 }} The marriage was never consummated.Vanderbilt II, Arthur T. Fortune's Children. Wm. Morrow and Co., 1989: 235-7. {{ISBN|0-688-07279-8}} On her wedding night, she was informed by her husband that he loathed her and could not stand the thought of touching her ever, although he wanted her to understand she was to be cordial to him in public and he might in turn occasionally call her "darling". He had, he admitted, married her for her money because poverty terrified him.Wayne Craven (2009) [https://books.google.com/books?id=1BrBHQfpEcAC&dq=gilded+mansions&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiq9dCilqLRAhUDBBoKHUKfCkkQ6AEIHTAA ''Gilded Mansions''], Norton, New York In 1915, the Lehrs were in Paris, and Elizabeth worked for the [[Red Cross]]. They remained in Paris after [[World War I]], where they bought in 1923 the ''Hôtel de Canvoie'' at 52, rue des Saints-Pères in the [[7th arrondissement of Paris|7th arrondissement]]. Harry Lehr died on January 3, 1929 of a brain malady in [[Baltimore]].{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Harry S. Lehr Dies. Once Social Leader. Succumbs To A Brain Malady In Johns Hopkins Hospital, Baltimore. Late Mrs. Astor's Adviser Noted For Daring And Originality Of His Parties. Married Mrs. J. V. Dahlgren, Heiress. Quickly Got Into Limelight. Furor Over "Monkey Dinner" Story. An Excellent Musician. |quote=[[Baltimore]], January 3, 1929. Harry Symes Lehr, for many years prominent in society of New York, Newport, Baltimore and Paris, died today of a brain disorder at [[Johns Hopkins Hospital]], where he had been a patient for several weeks. |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=January 4, 1929 }} ===Third marriage=== On May 25, 1936,{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Decies to Marry Mrs. Harry Lehr; Widow of New York Leader of Society to Become Bride of Irish Peer on May 23. Announcement in Paris. Bride-Elect Member of Drexel Family. Wrote Book, 'King Lehr and Gilded Age.' |quote=Mrs. Henry Symes Lehr, widow of Harry Lehr, society leader in New York early in the century, will be married here on May 23 to John Graham Beresford, Lord Decies, Irish peer, according to an announcement made today. |work=[[The New York Times]] |date= May 12, 1936}} she married [[John Beresford, 5th Baron Decies]] (1866–1944), a widower who had previously been married to [[Helen Vivien Gould]] (1893–1931).{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Lady Decies Dies at 38 in London. Former Helen Vivien Gould Was Principal in Brilliant International Wedding of 1911. Was Noted As Hostess. Her Entertaining Was a Feature of British Capital. Husband Is Distinguished Irish Peer. |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1931/02/03/archives/lady-decies-dies-at-38-in-london-former-helen-vivien-gould-was.html |quote=Lady Decies, the former Helen Vivien Gould, daughter of the late George Jay Gould of New York, died in London this morning. She had been critically ill here for several days. |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=February 3, 1931|accessdate=2007-11-26 }}{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Died |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,741088-2,00.html |quote=Lady Helen Vivien Decies, 39, daughter and heiress of the late George Jay Gould, wife of John Graham Hope de la Poer Beresford, 5th Baron Decies, Boer War veteran; of jaundice and heart attack; in London. |work=[[Time magazine]] |date=February 16, 1931 |accessdate=2009-02-04 }}{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=People |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,802366,00.html |quote=Heavily engraved invitations sent out by Lady Decies (formerly Elizabeth Drexel of Philadelphia) sent the British Library of Information bustling about over a point of etiquette. Said the invitation: "Lady Elizabeth Decies (the Right Honorable Elizabeth Beresford, Baroness Decies) requests the pleasure of your company," etc. But Lady Decies, pointed out the B.L.I., is merely wife of a privy councillor of the lowest rank of the peerage (John Graham Hope de la Poer Beresford, Baron Decies). is therefore a "Lady," but not a "Right Honorable." Nor can she call herself "Lady Elizabeth," nor "Elizabeth, Lady," titles proper only to the daughter of an earl or better or the widowed mother of a baron or married baronet, or the widow of a knight. |publisher=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |date=July 27, 1942 |accessdate=2007-07-21 }} He died on January 31, 1944.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Lord Decies dies in England at 77. Soldier, Sportsman, Friend of Taxpayer. Married Gould Heiress Here in 1911. |quote= |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=February 2, 1944 }} She died in 1944 at the Hotel Shelton. She was buried in the crypt below [[Dahlgren Chapel of the Sacred Heart|Dahlgren Chapel]] at [[Georgetown University]], which she and her first husband had built as a memorial to their son, Joseph Drexel Dahlgren, who died in infancy.{{cite news |first= |last= |authorlink= |coauthors= |title=Lady Decies, Widow of Irish Peer, Dies; Former Elizabeth Drexel of Philadelphia Was Once the Wife of Harry Lehr |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1944/06/14/archives/ladydeoieswidow-of-irish-peer-dies-former-elizabeth-drexel-ofi.html |quote= |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=June 14, 1944 |accessdate=2007-07-21 }} == Published works == *''"King Lehr" and the Gilded Age'' (1935) {{ISBN|1-4047-8242-7}} *''Turn of the World'' (1937) {{ISBN|978-1-4290-9080-3}} == References == {{reflist|30em}} == Further reading == * ''Time''; August 5, 1935; Review of ''"King Lehr" and the Gilded Age'' * [http://www.time.com/time/archive/preview/0,10987,848585,00.html ''Time''; May 18, 1936] announcing the engagement of "Mrs. Henry Symes Lehr" with Lord Decies. * [http://www.time.com/time/archive/preview/0,10987,756176,00.html ''Time''; June 1, 1936] announcing the marriage of "Mrs. Henry Symes Lehr" and Lord Decies. * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070928055222/http://www.cegesoma.be/pls/opac/opac.search?lan=N&seop=2&sele=51&sepa=12&doty=&sest=&chna=&senu=45033&rqdb=1&dbnu=1 Photo of Lord Decies and his wife] after the civil wedding on the steps of the Mairie of the [[7th arrondissement of Paris]]. * [http://thepeerage.com/p34757.htm#i347564 Peerage entry for John Vinton Dahlgren II] * Vanderbilt II, Arthur T. Fortune's Children. Wm. Morrow and Co., 1989. {{ISBN|0-688-07279-8}} == External links == {{Portal|Biography}} {{Commonscatinline}} * {{OL author}} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060307160602/http://www.kennedy-center.org/programs/theater/fnap/babe.html ''Great Day in the Morning''] is a play by [[Thomas Babe]], based on Elizabeth Wharton Drexel's life. * {{Find a Grave|23768034}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Drexel, Elizabeth Wharton}} [[Category:1868 births]] [[Category:1944 deaths]] [[Category:American people of Austrian descent]] [[Category:American socialites]] [[Category:Drexel family|Elizabeth Wharton]] [[Category:Gilded Age]]

{{Context|date=October 2009}} The '''GAO Human Capital Reform Act''' of 2004 ({{USStatute|108|271|118|811|2004|07|07}}) is a [[United States federal law]] designed to provide new [[human capital]] flexibilities with respect to the [[Government Accountability Office]], and for other purposes. The most visible provision of the law was to change the name of the organization from the General Accounting Office, which it had been known as since its founding in 1921, to the Government Accountability Office. Besides the name change, the law:
* Decouples GAO from the federal employee pay system, * Establishes a compensation system that places greater emphasis on job performance while protecting the purchasing power of employees who are performing acceptably, * Gives GAO permanent authority to offer voluntary early retirement opportunities and voluntary separation payments (buy-outs), * Provides greater flexibility for reimbursing employees for relocation benefits, * Allows certain employees and officers with less than three years of federal service to earn increased amounts of annual leave, and * Authorizes an exchange program with private sector organizations.
[[Category:2004 in law]] [[Category:Government Accountability Office|Human Capital Reform Act]] [[Category:United States federal government administration legislation]] [[Category:108th United States Congress]] [[Category:United States federal legislation articles without infoboxes]]
{{US-fed-statute-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=September 2011}} {{Infobox governor |name = Georgy Boos |image =Georgiy_Boos.jpg |caption= Georgy Boos in 2009 |order = 4th |office = Governor of Kaliningrad Oblast |term_start= 12 November 2005 |term_end= 27 September 2010 |predecessor= [[Vladimir Yegorov]] |successor= [[Nikolay Tsukanov]] |birth_date= 22 January 1963 |birth_place= Moscow, [[Russian SFSR]] |death_date= |death_place= |residence= |alma_mater= [[Moscow Power Engineering Institute]] |spouse= |profession= Businessman, politician |party= [[United Russia]] |religion= |signature= |footnotes= }} '''Georgy Valentinovich Boos''' ({{lang-ru|link=no|Георгий Валентинович Боос}}, born 22 January 1963) is a Russian businessman and politician, and was the governor of [[Kaliningrad Oblast]]. ==Early life and education== Boos was born in Moscow into a Crimean German family on 22 January 1963.{{cite web|title=Georgy Valentinovich Boos |url=http://www.holding-mrsk.ru/eng/about/managment/Board-of-Directors/detail.php?ID=10892 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924031003/http://www.holding-mrsk.ru/eng/about/managment/Board-of-Directors/detail.php?ID=10892 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=24 September 2015 |work=Russian Grids |accessdate=26 August 2013 }} His parents were both engineers.
He graduated from the [[Moscow Power Engineering Institute]] in 1986 with an engineering degree. In 1995 he received a Technical Sciences PhD (thesis - "Improving the efficiency of outdoor lighting installations of cities streets and squares" NIISF RAASN).[http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/604095/print Коммерсантъ.ru. Боос Георгий Валентинович] ==Career== Boss performed his military service in the Soviet Air Force between 1986 and 1988 based at [[Spassk-Dalny]]. In 1988 he was hired with the All-Union Technological and Lighting Scientific Research Institute, (VNISI), Moscow. where he remained for three years, holding the positions of Engineer, Senior Engineer and Junior Researcher. During the same time period, he was also a mathematics teacher at School № 247 in Moscow. 1991-1995 - director of the Moscow Scientific Production lighting Enterprise " Svetoservis ", which was founded by him and his father. In 1993 the company became a joint stock company, and Boos became its CEO. Since 1994, the firm is engaged in art-architectural lighting municipal facilities of Moscow as the main contractor.[http://www.rudnikov.com/article.php?IBLOCK_ID=1&SECTION_ID=0&ELEMENT_ID=13473 Досье губернатора Бооса.] For his work on many enterprise professional exhibitions was medalist and winner of awards.[http://sdrussia.artinfo.ru/articles.text?menu=52&id=118 ООО "СВЕТОСЕРВИС"] (Russian Union of Designers) [http://www.interlight.messefrankfurt.ru/index.php?option=com_resource&controller=article&article=992&category_id=57&Itemid=5 Interlight Moscow 2013 - results of the exhibition] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140303021902/http://www.interlight.messefrankfurt.ru/index.php?option=com_resource&controller=article&article=992&category_id=57&Itemid=5 |date=3 March 2014 }}[http://www.interlight.messefrankfurt.ru/index.php?option=com_resource&controller=article&article=646&category_id=59&Itemid=9 Interlight Moscow 2012 — the first lighting up exhibition of Russia] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140303020858/http://www.interlight.messefrankfurt.ru/index.php?option=com_resource&controller=article&article=646&category_id=59&Itemid=9 |date=3 March 2014 }}[http://design-review.net/index.php?show=article&id=90&year=2006&number=1 Дизайн 2005] (Design Review) The company " Svetoservis " patented a number of lighting [[solution]]s, in the development of which involved GV Boos.[http://bankpatentov.ru/node/390990 Lamps for gardens] Among them - the industrial design " Lamp " (1995), well known as " vandal-proof " : designed for use in doorways .[http://www.businesspress.ru/newspaper/article_mId_37_aId_67095.html Boos lamp illuminate entrances][http://www.newkaliningrad.ru/news/others/146326-.html Wizards bring light] From 1995 to 1998 and again from 1999 to 2005, he was a deputy of the [[State Duma]], a vice-speaker (29 December 2003—21 September 2005). Boos is known as a close ally to Moscow mayor [[Yuri Luzhkov]]. He was a member of centrist [[Fatherland - All Russia|Fatherland party]] led by Luzhkov, since it merged with Unity party he became a member of [[United Russia]]. From 29 September until 23 December 1998, by resolution of Russian Federation Government, was appointed as the Chairman of the State Tax Service of the Russian Federation (from 23 December until 25 May 1999, by the Decree of the President of the Russian Federation become a Minister of the Russian Federation for Taxes and Levies). In May 1999, dismissed with the Primakov cabinet. On 14 September 2005 he was proposed by President [[Vladimir Putin]] to the [[Kaliningrad Oblast]] legislature as a governor of [[Kaliningrad Oblast]] and was approved soon after this. His tenure as governor ended in September 2010. 28 December 2011 G. Boos was appointed Chairman of the Board of Directors of VVC (All-Russian Exhibition Centre),[http://www.rbcdaily.ru/2011/12/27/market/562949982405342 Russian Exhibition Center for Boos and Nisanova] but in June 2012 dismissed from the post.[http://www.rbcdaily.ru/2012/07/02/market/562949984226430 Deputy Sobyanin will do the Reconstruction of Russian Exhibition Center][http://www.newkaliningrad.ru/news/community/1624388-georgiya-boosa-snyali-s-proekta-rekonstruktsii-vvts-.html Georgy Boos removed from the reconstruction project of the Russian Exhibition Center] 14 January 2012 elected to the Board of Directors of the Holding of Interregional Distribution Grid Companies[http://www.newkaliningrad.ru/news/community/1429196-georgiy-boos-izbran-v-sovet-direktorov-mrsk.html Georgy Boos elected to the Board of Directors of IDGC] (JSC "Russian network"), and then was its chairman[http://www.newkaliningrad.ru/news/economy/1442324-georgiy-boos-vozglavil-energeticheskiy-kholding-mrsk.html Georgy Boos headed Energy Holding IDGC] until 28 June 2013.[http://www.rugrad.eu/news/603623/ Georgy Boos resigned as chairman of the board of directors "Rosseti"] Is the owner of the holding "Boos Lighting groups".[http://www.lenta.ru/lib/14170234/ Georgy Boos on Lenta.ru] BL GROUP BOOS LIGHTING GROUP is a holding company that combines: a group of companies “Svetoservis”, «GALAD» and «OPORA engenering».[http://www.bl-g.ru/ Sites of holding BL GROUP] The company "Svetoservis" was founded in 1991.[http://www.kommersant.ru/factbook/48353 B-Directory] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112151707/http://www.kommersant.ru/factbook/48353 |date=12 November 2014 }}[http://www.press-release.ru/branches/mashinino/47f9bdff05ece/?print=yes The formation of Russia's largest lighting holding BL Group is finished] The main activity of the company: to create and develop a comfortable, functional and esthetic light environment, using progressive and ecological technologies and products of artificial light.[http://www.svetoservis.ru/index.php/about About Group][http://www.promportal.ru/userinfo365 Promportal.RU] In 1991, the company "Svetoservis" has entered the Moscow electrotechnical market to offer complex of services for the design, installation and operation of lighting systems of all kinds of lighting.[http://www.rudnikov.com/article.php?IBLOCK_ID=1&SECTION_ID=0&ELEMENT_ID=13473 DOSSIER GOVERNOR BOOS] {{ad|date=October 2018}} In 1994 the Moscow government decided to create a light-color in a single environment, using a model of quality architectural lighting for the entire city. "Svetoservis" under the leadership of Boos GV, able to offer its innovative manufacturing business solutions for the implementation of a single set of architectural and art illumination of any buildings in the capital. On the eve of 1994 was successfully commissioned the first object - the hotel "Ukraine".[http://www.lawmix.ru/mskzk/68542 Resolution of the Government of Moscow][http://www.kommersant.ru/doc/14826 Kommersant.ru] Since 1994, the architectural and art illumination is a visiting card of the company. "Scientific and production lighting company "Svetoservis"" becomes multiple prize winner in many professional exhibitions, won numerous awards, including awards "Victoria" in the exhibitions of Russian design "Lighting Design", International and European Prize "For the quality of services" and others.[http://sdrussia.artinfo.ru/articles.text?menu=52&id=118 Russian Union of Designers][http://design-review.net/index.php?show=article&id=90&year=2006&number=1 Design-Review][http://spb.media-office.ru/?go=5545841&pass=01bedc9cc16d01ae4c8ea013e39e60eb Exhibition Interlight Moscow][http://sila-sveta.com.ua/pdf/Digest_Sila_Sveta.pdf Magazine "Power of Light"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120710061839/http://sila-sveta.com.ua/pdf/Digest_Sila_Sveta.pdf |date=10 July 2012 }} The company implemented more than 6,000 projects, architectural, outdoor, landscape, sports and indoor lighting in more than 30 cities of Russia and abroad. Created: airports, railway transport hubs, culverts, residential infrastructure, sports and cultural complexes.[http://www.1tv.ru/news/print/206439 You can see Moscow in a new light at night now][http://www.svetoservis.ru/files/mir_dorog_69-2.pdf Magazine "Peace of Road"] Among them: the Triumphal Arch,[http://www.lightrussia.ru/lib/articles/?id=107315 Architectural lighting of the Triumphal Arch] Large-scale interactive media facades in New Arbat,[http://radiovesti.ru/article/show/article_id/43091 In the heart of the capital will be media facades] Moscow Planetarium,[http://forum.planetarium-moscow.ru/showthread.php?t=695&s=f743df90406e84569e30bf2d46590fa2 lighting project of the Moscow Planetarium] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112181459/http://forum.planetarium-moscow.ru/showthread.php?t=695 |date=12 November 2014 }} Lomonosov Moscow State University,[http://docs.cntd.ru/document/3600540 MOSCOW GOVERNMENT DECREE][http://kuban.svetoservis.ru/index.php?Itemid=39&id=24&option=com_content&task=view Outdoor Lighting] Mariinsky Theatre in St. Petersburg.[http://www.bl-g.ru/upload/SMI/Zodchij_3-2013_2.pdf Magazine "Architect of the 21st century»][http://www.1tv.ru/news/culture/232116 The new Mariinsky Theatre met the first spectators] "Svetoservis" develops conceptual solutions, as in the scale of cities and individual architectural objects. Architectural lighting concept designed for the cities of Lipetsk, Perm, Surgut, Sochi. Designed and commissioned lighting concept of the Moscow Kremlin, highway Novy Arbat - Kutuzov Avenue.[http://center.ria.ru/economy/20120322/82630658.html Illumination on Novy Arbat and Kutuzov could cost 35 million rubles a year] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112155355/http://center.ria.ru/economy/20120322/82630658.html |date=12 November 2014 }}[http://inmsk.ru/news_interview/20120322/344235603.html Muscovites will see Novy Arbat in a new light] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141112180415/http://www.inmsk.ru/news_interview/20120322/344235603.html |date=12 November 2014 }} Thanks to "Svetoservis" 38 luxury bridges across the Moscow River shine with the colors of gems.[http://www.m24.ru/articles/28414 38 bridges across the Moscow River shine with the colors of gems][http://m.rg.ru/2013/11/13/most.html Bridge with tiger eye] "Svetoservis" has developed and implemented a project of lighting legendary Olympic Park Sochi 2014.[http://arch-sochi.ru/2011/11/kontseptsiya-formirovaniya-svetovoy-sredyi-olimpiyskogo-parka/ The concept of forming the light environment of the Olympic Park][http://galad.ru/about/news/518208/ The first Olympic victories] Boos' income in 2008 amounted to 122,370,965 rubles, of which 841,572 rubles earned on the main job, were transferred to the accounts of orphanages Kaliningrad region.[http://compromat.info/page_28055.htm Houses, cars, ATVs and 21 lighting company] In 2009, revenue was 86.4 million rubles.[http://www.vedomosti.ru/newspaper/article/2010/05/04/233214 VEDOMOSTI - A salary - to give a salary to children] ==Personal life== Boos married three times. First to Valentina Boos, secondly to Elena Vladimirovna Lerina-Boos and third to Anna Boos. He has six children. ==Honours and award== * [[Order For Merit to the Fatherland]] 4th class (21 January 2008) - for outstanding contribution to the socio-economic development of the region and many years of fruitful work[http://document.kremlin.ru/doc.asp?ID=43807 Указ Президента Российской Федерации от 21 января 2008 года № 53] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111103015112/http://document.kremlin.ru/doc.asp?ID=43807 |date=3 November 2011 }} * [[Order of Honour (Russia)|Order of Honour]] (28 January 2004) - for active participation in legislative activities and many years of diligent work[http://images.garant.ru/navigation.dsp?PHPSESSID=c2fc0e87aeb7ca65ad59ae3ef681d4c3&number=0&page=1 Собрание законодательства Российской Федерации 2 февраля 2004, № 5, ст. 356]{{dead link|date=October 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * Medal "For Services in the Conduct of the Population Census" * [[Medal "In Commemoration of the 850th Anniversary of Moscow"]] * [[Medal "In Commemoration of the 300th Anniversary of Saint Petersburg"]] * [[Jubilee Medal "70 Years of the Armed Forces of the USSR"]] * State Prize of the Russian Federation in the field of literature and art in 1996 (29 May 1997) - for the formation of light-color Moscow environment[http://document.kremlin.ru/doc.asp?ID=074749 Указ Президента Российской Федерации от 29 мая 1997 года № 532 «О присуждении Государственных премий Российской Федерации в области литературы и искусства 1996 года»] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111103015145/http://document.kremlin.ru/doc.asp?ID=074749 |date=3 November 2011 }} * Diploma of the Government of the Russian Federation (6 July 1999) - for services to the state and years of diligent work[http://www.pravoteka.ru/pst/837/418433.html Распоряжение Правительства Российской Федерации от 6 июля 1999 года № 1069-р «О награждении Почётной грамотой Правительства Российской Федерации Бооса Г. В.»] * Medal "Federation Council. 15 years "(2008) - for many years of hard work, great contribution to the interaction of the Federation Council of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation and state bodies, organizations in the development and improvement of the federal legislation of the Russian Federation, and the strengthening of the Russian state in connection with the 15th anniversary Council of Federation of the Federal Assembly of the Russian Federation[http://www.knia.ru/news/3986.html Георгий Боос награждён медалью Совета Федерации] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140320220015/http://www.knia.ru/news/3986.html |date=20 March 2014 }} * Commander of the Order "For Merit" ([[Gabon]], 2000)[http://www.africana.ru/GD/Boos/Gabon_Cameroon.htm Георгий Боос. Поездка в Габон и Камерун.] * Order of Holy Blessed Prince Daniel of Moscow II degree (ROC, 2006)[http://www.smoleparh.ru/News/View/1209 Святейший Патриарх Алексий совершил всенощное бдение в Крестовоздвиженском соборе Калининграда.] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20120914160450/http://www.smoleparh.ru/News/View/1209 |date=14 September 2012 }} * Higher Law Award "Themis" (17 February 2007) in the category "Russia and Europe" - For the development of civil society in the process of integration of the Russian Federation and the European Union[http://www.newkaliningrad.ru/news/politics/204842-.html Георгий Боос был удостоен Высшей юридической премии] * Honorary Doctor of BFU. Kant (2012){{cite web |url=http://kaliningrad.ru/news/policy/item/19369-boos-perezagruzka-reportazh-kaliningradru |title=Боос. Перезагрузка |accessdate=2012-07-01 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/69hiYrp3j?url=http://kaliningrad.ru/news/policy/item/19369-boos-perezagruzka-reportazh-kaliningradru |archivedate=6 August 2012 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *This article incorporates material translated from Russian Wikipedia *[http://www.peoples.ru/state/politics/georgiy_boos/index.html Biography in Russian from Peoples.ru] {{Commons category|Georgy Valentinovich Boos}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Boos, Georgy}} [[Category:1963 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Moscow]] [[Category:Russian businesspeople]] [[Category:Members of the State Duma (Russian Federation)]] [[Category:Russian-German people]] [[Category:Governors of Kaliningrad Oblast]] [[Category:Heads of the federal subjects of Russia]] [[Category:United Russia politicians]] [[Category:Our Home – Russia politicians]] [[Category:20th-century Russian politicians]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Honour (Russia)]] [[Category:Communist Party of the Soviet Union members]] [[Category:21st-century Russian politicians]] [[Category:Moscow Power Engineering Institute alumni]]
